Bought and played it for the meme with some friends on Discord. 

Honestly, the most fun I've had in a long time. If you're a history buff, and understand the humor behind the game, and don't take it as a serious dating simulator, you'll love every second of it. 

However, if you're here for the "dating" and "story" you'll be slightly disappointed.

I can say that while there is plenty of jokes about Russia, Germany, France, Poland, and many other countries who were involved in the war, there is not much in the way of "dating" I guess you could say.

If you don't want spoilers, stop reading, but the ending is somewhat disappointing.

[spoiler] The ending, which happens after you hook up with one tank (and unfortunately, you cannot bang the Maus), basically ends with you seeing about 30 seconds of an image of your desired tank, with or without nudity due to the XXX patch, which you can find on google (don't worry, its nothing fishy, the dev posted it), is honestly really disappointing. To me, I think a dating simulator should have either no ending, or allow you to engage with all the characters of the players desire, without any outside forces from stopping you. I hooked up with the T34, because Russian bias and the USSR memes that come with. After the night of what I assume was 57mm penetration, you awake to a knock at your door. Military police. You go to court for deserting your post, are found innocent, and charged with banging a tank, in laymans terms. The game then basically ends, tells what all of the characters do in their lives, and your character gets shot when he is reassigned to a combat position. No more hot ammo racks, and enveloping penetration for you, comrade. [/spoiler]

OVERALL:
1945/10 for history memes
4/10 for story
100/1 for characters (tbh they're all a good meme)
1/10 for ending and replay value

Panzermadels: Tank Dating Simulator.
This thought provoking visual novel took me on an immense mental and spiritual journey, showing me light where there is seemingly none. Recieving this masterpiece as a present from a caring, brilliant friend, I immediately installed the game, unaware of the heart-tearing love I'd accumilate for these innocent, delicate tanks. 
Delving further into the game I began making strong, emotional bonds with the tanks, I felt that i could really see their beautiful, peaceful souls behind the mass of armour and armoured skirts.
I was so taken away by this game, my whole life had been taken away from me for 3 hours, I became a new man, I became Erwin Lemmor. Seeing through the eyes of this character, I couldn't help but melt in my chair, as the backgrounds and histories of the tanks were revealed to me, never once has my heart gone so soft.
Finally feeling what it was like to have feeling, to love and to cherish. A tear rolls down my eye, at that moment I felt my mind, my body and my heart dedicated to these tanks. 
I wish it could last forever.
10/10 characters
10/10 dialogue
10/10 changed me as a person
1/10 left me heartbroken

35184533.review:
Panzermadels is an insane gag VN, which places the protagonist in a military school with girls personifying WW2 tanks. The story makes no sense whatsoever, but is full of cool historic/military references and delivers some genuinely funny characters (my personal favourite being the yandere IS-2). It’s definitely targeted towards World War 2 geeks such as myself and really works well in this respect – also, while short, it offers multiple “romance” options with different tanks/girls and your choice in that matter influences the story quite a lot, creating a lot of replayability. If you wish to explore the game fully, it should give you around 6-7 hours of decent entertainment.

The art and music are nothing special, but they work and CGs are mostly very nice to look at. [b]What I have to mention though is lack of proper options menu, no autoplay and generally very clunky interface[/b]. I would probably play it more if it had the typical “skip read only” option and didn’t continue skipping after choices, with no easy option to rewind the text. There’s also some glitches, that often can even persist through restarting or loading the game (I had all backgrounds missing on one playthrough, with just black screen behind the text and character sprites). It’s easy to see that it was made as a first attempt by an inexperienced team and Devgru-p’s second title, “Stay! Stay! DPRK” is much, much better in this respect.

[b]Considering the technical issues, I only recommend buying this game while on sale – it’s definitely worth your time if you care about the theme, but the production qualities simply doesn’t justify the 10 dollar pricetag.[/b] The core content nevertheless is very enjoyable and it’s obvious that developers made it with a lot of humour and most likely had genuine fun in the process.

34816592.review:
For what it's worth, Panzermadels is pretty good if you want a lighthearted, humerous, and strangely historically accurate dating sim. The writing isn't perfect, nor is the art, but the situations and the bizarre setting make up for it, and it *is* aimed at men so you are constantly bombarded by affectionate women and rewarded with showing some skin. Despite this, Panzermadels actually contains some moments that I really didn't expect relative to the depth of the overall game.

The only disappointing factor in this game (besides that you might be the one playing it) is the ending. The endings occur rather abruptly and they don't really give you much closure. It was rather unsatisfying compared to the whole list of shenanigans that happened throughout the game, and it really put a damper on the experience.

This is actually entertaining.  The jokes made me laugh, the story was absurd and engaging, the dialogue wasn't dull, and there were some interesting choices to make.   The only obvious downside for a while was one or two typos of character names.  

HOWEVER, the ending was poor.  Not only was a whole scene clearly ripped off an episode of the BBC comedy Blackadder Goes Forth, but there apparently isn't a single happy ending.  I know this is a parody, but it was a good parody, and I wanted a happy ending!  I loved Tiger I as much as anyone could love a cartoon character they've engaged with for ten minutes of dialogue.  

The final reward image you get for completing a romantic storyline is also weird.  Clearly the attempt was to make this higher quality than the rest of the imagery, but it doesn't work.  Tiger I doesn't look anything like she does in the rest of the game.  With one image she's skillfully transformed from a believable and human (tank?) character to a soulless Victorian porn star showing off more leg than a man can handle. That blows up, heh, the ending, and the whole game suffers from a bitter anticlimax to an hour's romantic entanglement with a fictional tank.  Because of this I would not recommend.

33128608.review:
Panzermadels... 

Ладно, начнем с хорошего. 

Это довольно веселая игра, этого я скрывать не стану. Тут полно забавных шуток, прикольных отсылок к массовой культуре и историческим событиям, и  просто комичных ситуаций. Юмор в этой новелле не блещет британской тонкостью, но тем не менее, со своей основной задачей вполне хорошо справляется. Он веселит, и это главное. 

Второй плюс это довольно милые персонажи и приятные романтические линии, собственно, ради чего обычно и играют в дейт-симы. Панзер-девочки все сделаны достаточно приятно, каждая имеет какой-то уникальный характер (пускай по большей части и шаблонный, но все же), да и руты, не сказать, что изобилуют, но все-таки имеют в себе пару трогательных моментов. 

А вот теперь о плохом. 

Очень низкое качество технического исполнения. Игра тупо выглядит как поделка, слепленная на коленке за пару недель. Настроек нет, открыть на весь экран нельзя, размер окошка не регулируется. У всех персонажей по два-три спрайта, нарисованных довольно бедно, бэкграунды вообще представляют собой фотографии, размазанные в фотошопе. Музыка состоит из набора бесплатных сэмплов, причем используемых чуть ли не повсеместно. При этом, звукорежиссеру я бы просто руки оторвал и засунул в задницу (хотя, это все равно, что не отрывать их вовсе), потому что иногда эффекты слишком громкие и резкие, иногда музыка совсем не подходит под ситуацию, а иногда звук и вовсе отсутствует. Это просто кошмар. 
Хорошо получились разве что CG, но по одному на каждый рут это, как минимум, мало. 

И второй минус - это концовка. Это самая разочаровывающая и просто бесящая часть игры.
[spoiler] Серьезно, между плохой и хорошей концовкой почти нет разницы. Либо тебя казнят после проведения трибунала, либо ты умираешь на войне.[/spoiler] 
Причем, мне довелось почитать отмазки разработчико в духе: "это пародия на дейт-симы, чего вы ждали?" - и вот это меня просто, блять, бесит. Вы, тупорылые ебуч~ 
*звук перемотки* 

Кхм. Ладно. Итоги. 
От меня Panzermadels получает оценку 6 PanzerKampfWagen'ов из 10. В принципе, поиграть можно. Я даже посоветую. В конце концов, кручение шашней с танками здесь сделано вполне хорошо. Но (ох, не думал, что скажу это) только пиратить или брать по скидке. Вообще никак иначе. Потому что 250 рублей, сколько за нее просят, игра не стоит. Да блин, даже 124, сколько я за нее отдал, не стоит. Не могу сказать, что я жалею о потраченных деньгах или о трех часах, которые я потратил на Тигр-рут, но серьезно, объективно, не стоит. За такую же цену я купил себе третий том [url=store.steampowered.com/app/602520/NEKOPARA_Vol_3/]Nekopara[/url], в котором вообще нет геймплея, и который я прочитал за 6 часов, но в котором была намного более качественная техническая сторона, и который тупо не разочаровывал. 

В общем, еще раз. 6/10. Поиграть все-таки, наверное, порекомендую, но многого ждать не стоит.

31685297.review:
This game is enjoyable, but it's not worth $10. The premise is amusing enough, and was executed adequately. I loved all the historical references, especially the more obscure ones (such as the speculation that Panzer was in Mädchen in Uniform), as well as the irreverent (to put it mildly) sense of humor throughout. And the military-related jokes were spot on.

But the problems were present, and quite jarring. For one thing, the game is chock full of grammatical and spelling errors, and rather obvious ones at that. Then there's the bugs: Skipping in one place made my game crash so badly that only the Task Manager could close it, and even then, my Steam client thought it was still running, so I couldn't restart it or play a different game. Even using the Task Manager to close Steam didn't help here. The only thing that helped was restarting my computer. Also, there's a line of dialogue in the kitchen that is attributed to Panzer, no matter who's actually saying it, and under some conditions, the school music plays throughout the rest of the game, even when you change scenes, and even while other music was playing. Such basic errors are inexcusable, and indicative of rushed, sloppy work.

Then there's the adult content patch. It hardly does anything, other than adding a risqué drawing of whatever tank you manage to win over. The drawings are nice, but they're really not much, and the patch itself is even bigger than the actual game. But perhaps this is due to the fact that this game was made with TyranoBuilder (hint to the creators--RenPy is much better in this regard, and many others).

Overall, I give this game a 6/10. Fun to play for the most part, but the bugs and bad grammar really bring it down.

31473765.review:
[h1] I honestly don't understand why this one has such high ratings. [/h1]

This is a rather short, 6 hours tops, VN, telling a story of a guy, who was sent to the school, where all the girls are anthropomorphic version of tanks, and this fact is the main seller of the game. While this idea sounds interesting enough to buy the game just out of curiosity, after completing one route and starting the game anew to finish another one, you begin to see many problems it has.

[h1] Story [/h1]

You are Erwin, a cadet who was sent to Japanese Tank School as a part of his training. After arriving to the school however, you find out, that all of the students are girls, and they are actually tanks. Five of them can be dated. So you choose between:

- Sherman the Tomboy
- T-34 the Tsundere
- IS-2 the Yandere
- Panzer IV the Ditz
- Tiger I the Himedere (I think she's more like dandere though, but who cares)

So after choosing one, you start to work your way to the good ending, through some usual anime stuff, like school life, dates, hot springs and beaches.

Doesn't sound too bad so far? Well, for the first hour and a half you can get some enjoyment from it. Panzermadels got a heavy focus on comedy and using anime related stereotypes, and while jokes and references aren't always that funny, sometimes they can make you smile a bit. Also it's interesting to find out how things will work out with the girl you chose.

And when you get to the ending, you start to see the first problems.

First off, the endings are pretty much bad and very bad. After doing everything right and even getting a chance to visit the insides of a tank (kinda like the favourite joke of the devs) you are [spoiler]getting court martialed and sent to the penal squad, and then you die in battle, while never getting a chance to interact with the girl you dated[/spoiler], or, if you screwed up in some way [spoiler]getting court martialed and shot immideately[/spoiler]. You know, I kinda believe that there should be a way to win in any game, even if it's VN. Getting somewhat immersed and then recieving an ending like this is pretty much a slap in the face.

But ok. Let's say you can deal with it. You start to hope there's some enjoyment to be found in completing other routes.
But no. As you read through the familiar intro stuff as you do in any VN, you start to see that nothing is changing, almost at all. And that's the biggest problem of the game:

[b] Except dates, all of the scenes for different girls are pretty much the same, so by reading one route, which takes around 2 hours, you see 80% of the game [/b]

It becomes worst when you get to the ending again and realise, that the only difference between routes is the CG of the girl in the final scene. As a result, the only reason to replay the game is to read through a date scene and unlock a sexy art. But is it really worth it? And that brings us to...

[h1] Art [/h1]

Talking about art in VN suggests discussing character CG, backgrounds and fullscreen art for especially important moments of the game.

Character CG is pretty much fair. It may be good or average, depending on your art tastes, but I don't think it can be considered bad. I do think though that the design is kinda boring, all of the tank girls look simply like girls, without any perks that can define what kind of the tank they are. I'm not talking about something mecha-related, like in Kantai Collection or Panzer Waltz. Hair clips, badges, hairstyles and clothes - all of that stuff could be creatively used for that purpose. And what can we see in the game? German tanks are blondes, and Maus super-heavy tank got huge tits. Bravo. Also there could be more variation in poses, since there's only around 2 or 3 for each girl.

Backgrounds are simply lazy. By the look of it, I'm pretty sure that every background is simply a blurred photo, there are even some random people in the place that's supposed to be a school caffeterria, and random 20+ aged guy in the kitchen where only our main hero is supposed to be. Come on.

And fullscreen art. The only important moment in the game, it seems, is the sex scene, since you only get one for each girl. And it simply shows your chosen tank girl in some suggesting pose. Also, while the game was luring people with promises of some hentai content, actual H-patch was released around year later. People in comments talk about it like it's goddamn miracle and best thing to happen in their life. In reality, only thing it did was removing pants and other stuff so you can see nipples and vaginas. Totally worth it. And it really bothers me, that those arts are done in different styles. I mean, what the hell? Even if different people done them, they should've tried to make them look at least somewhat similar.

[h1] Music and Sound [/h1]

Not much to say about it. Of course, it's not a voiced VN, so there are some sound effects only, which pretty much do the job. Same can be said about music, nothing out of this world, but nothing to complain about either.

[h1] Technical Issues [/h1]

While performance doesn't really matter in VN, I did encounter some problems.

- Game takes some time to load, at least a minute
- Skip button skips ALL of the text, there's no way to skip only previously read text
- Skipping text in the clubs related part of the game makes two music themes play at the same time, restart needed
- Loading saves in some parts of the game doesn't let you advance (you'll have to load different save)

As you can see, it's not very polished product, but chances are you won't encounter any problems at least on your first run.

[h1] Verdict [/h1]

4/10. Could be 5/10, if it was really cheap or free. It is too short, lazy and disappointing to be sold for its price. If you think I'm greedy or being rough on indie developers, note that they had Patreon and Kickstarter for this game and now sell it here, while much better novels like Katawa Shoujo and Endless Summer were totally free.

Don't buy it unless it's on 90% discount and you wanna prove me wrong badly.

For the low, low price of $10, you can...
[list]
[*]Fuck a tank
[*]Regret buying this game
[*]Contemplate suicide (was that just me?)
[*]Laugh at bad World War II and tank puns
[*]Learn about penetration and maneuvers ( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°)
[*]Have your favorite tank get turned into a Japanese schoolgirl and otaku... (rip PzKpfw IV: 1939-1945 never forget. You killed many of those Bolshevik pigs. You did good)
[*]Question how tank parts translate to body parts and clothing (So if their skirts are armored skirts, does that mean that the early PzKpfw IV was naked? Is any tank without an armored skirt naked? WHY AM I EVEN THINKING ABOUT THIS!?)
[*] Waste >3 hours of your life playing this game
[*]Feel like a filthy weeb
[*]Look at pictures of softcore tank porn (I need an adult. Wait, I am one, fuck... I NEED ANOTHER ADULT!)
[/list]

Seriously, though, this isn't a bad game. 

The story goes like apparently every other virtual novel (this is my first AND LAST one). You're a male student transferring to another school, but in this case it's a "tank school." For some reason, you're in Japan, even though you're an American soldier. You get lost and have to decide between going to a convenience store or a mechanic's shop. Going to the mechanic's shop, you'll meet a mechanic who directs you to the school. Your other option is to go to the convenience store, you'll meet the American tank, the M4 Sherman. She leads you to the school, the "Tank School." Who cares about the story, so I'm justing going to skip it right now and get on to the tanks. Your options on which tank you want to fuck are: Panzer IV, Tiger I, M4 Sherman, T-34, and IS-2.

PzKpfw IV is a secret nazi who hides behind her "love of Japan" to seem innocent. The puns and jokes about the Blitzkrieg and National Socialism were alright. Who wouldn't love a joke like, "It's not like we're a bunch of J- just made of money people, heh heh..." The Führer would be proud. Hitler ist so kawaii~!  Load the AP rounds, get the war machine moving, anschluss some friends, and Blitzkrieg them all ( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°). Für des Deutsches Vaterland!

The M4 Sherman is a loud, fast-food obsessed tank, because 'murica. The best part is when you reenact D-Day ( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°).

Tiger I is a tank that breaks down a lot. "Hans, ze transmission broke." 

T-34 is a CYKA. We must protect the Russian-speaking minority, comrades. Crimea is ours, and the Ukraine is also ours. So is Poland, and eastern Germany, and the Baltics, and the Balkans, and...

IS-2 is Stalin's imbred child who's ready to get punished ( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°). Who's ready to flank some fascists and run over German children? Rape their women, comrades! Shoot the old! That is the way of Stalin!

TOG 2 is a secret British tank you can do "things" with in a pool ( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°)

And who could forget about the memorable side characters like:
Char-B1, hon hon hon
The tank that Deutschland Blitzed so hard it's not relevent anymore
A tractor from the far away land of New Zealand
The Maus, with her big... ammo racks ( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°)
That guy from Full Metal Jacket and insurance commercials
CYKA tank v2
Shopkeeper guy
AND MANY MORE!

Also, you're the great-grandson of Erwin Rommel. Your name's Erwin Lemmor, because you're in witness protection after the whole North Africa and Western Front thing. So go show Panzer IV what you know about combat moneuvers ( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°)

So anyway, back to the story. You spend 2 weeks at this school. During these weeks, you'll connect with these tanks by: going on a scavenger hunt, going on a field trip to a hot spring, missing a dance because the drill-sergeant is an ass, getting yelled at by your tank, making it up by pealing potatoes, getting dirty, needing to take a shower, and anschlussing them after the shower at your apartment ( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°).

In the end, you're arrested for going AWOL since you went to the wrong school. At your trial, your drill-sergeant becomes your lawyer because plot and attempts to defend you against the charges. He calls M4 Sherman as a witness, and she fucks it up (just like the Vietnam war). You're about to get the death sentence by shooting squad when your tank comes running in with a paper that proves it wasn't your fault for going to the wrong tank school. So they dismiss the charges, excpet GUESS WHAT YOU LITTLE SHIT, you fucked a tank last night, so you're going to now have to fight in a penal battalion on the Eastern Front against Plane Girls. You become an NCO eventually, but get fatally wounded in a battle. But you died doing what you loved, riding tanks ( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°). 

Oh wait, I forgot to metion that fucking IS-2 gets you the death sentence because she doesn't show up to the trial. Whoops, you shouldn't have "put your barrel in crazy." (that's an actual quote from the game)

During the end screen, you find out what happens to the characters:
Panzer IV started the new NSDAP and attempted a coup, but the party got banned
Sherman eats knock-off McDonald's for the rest of her life
T-34 governs Korea
Tiger I runs a museum in England. (Get it, because the only surviving Tiger I from the war is there HAHAHAHAHAHAA)
The drill sergeant becomes the drill sergeant in a rip-off Full Metal Jacket.

THE END.

10/10 because you can fuck a PzKpfw IV ( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°)( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°)( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°)( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°)( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°)( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°)( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°)( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°)( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°)( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°)( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°)( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°)( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°)

SIde note: 
Now when I look at a picture of a PzKpfw IV, all I can see is a Japanese schoolgirl saying, "Anschluss me." Worth the $10 bucks. 

Okay, this is a real side note now:
The ending was horrible. I get that this was sarcasm, and I did buy this for a laugh, BUT WHAT THE FUCK WAS THE ENDING? Nothing, that's what it was.

29410777.review:
Oook where do I even start with this?

[h1]Lets awnser the main questions about this game:[/h1]

[u]Will people think I'm weird for playing this game?[/u]
[i]Unless you have a friend like me who is obsessed with Tanks? Yes, the second I booted this game 2 of my friends (which were the only ones awake at the time) immediatly sent me a message relating to "What the f***" or "You have a problem fam"[/i]

[u]Who is this games target audience?[/u]
[i]Anyone who likes tanks or girls, but mostly tank lovers, This game has ALOT of tank humor and a metric $h17 Ton of puns. If you are a fan of WW2, Tanks, and Dark humor this game will leave you SPEECHLESS at some of the jokes, supremely dark humor, puns, and burns that come out of this game. Props to the Devs for doing their homework[/i]

[u]Can you *ahem* "Get down" with the tanks?[/u]
[i]Its implied in the game if you get close with one. Currently the dev team is working on an H-Patch for the game for all steam users, so big props to them and actually gives me a reason to support a Patreon for once[/i]

[u]How good is this game/novel[/u]
[i]This is where I struggle to give good reps to the Devs, my biggest gripe is that the game is kinda short, the 2.6 hours I put in is for 1 ending (Tiger I is best currently shippable tank, Maus is best tank overall) and its not the most satisfying thing in the world. Plus there is currently a lack of endings, so far if you do any searching on google you basically get 1 of two endings or a "secret 3rd" (more down below) [/i]

[u]Would you reccomend I buy this game Angel-San?[/u]
[i]If you're into Tanks and Tank humor? Get it!!! but only on sale really, like I did currently in this games state... it feels a tad... unfinished. And paying 10 dollars for a game with the worlds most unsatifsying endings makes me cringe... hard.... seriously Dev Team work on that in future patches and this game is gold for Tank and war fans.[/i]

[h1]My thoughts on this game[/h1]

This game was REALLY good in many parts, and is actually a game that had me laughing almost the entire time, it also made me realize that I probably need help regarding my obsession with tanks. This is the first visual novel that actually had me more invested in the convrosations and other humor in the center of it rather than the ending. Which is quite frankly just awesome in so many ways. Ive played quite a few VNs and frankly this comes in 2nd for me just under Katawa Shoujo (a game that will likely never be toppled in the fact its so amazing and well done). 

This game does have a rather cheapish vibe to it. If you're a fan of Kevin MacLeod's music you will instantly recognize just about any soundtrack in this game during the chill moments. The art is solid, but I feel it could indeed be improved upon with future updates, but the artstyle does kinda grow on you the more you play this game, just dont expect God Tier work. 

Finally.... DEVGRU-P if you are reading this.... do yourselves a colossal favor with the next patch and [b]ADD MORE ENDINGS!!!!!!![/b]

Warning! Spoilers ahead regarding the endings! Which may or may not make or break your experience with this game!
[spoiler]Every single tank apart from the IS-2 I believe has the same f***ing ending it sounds like. You get court marshaled and accused of desertion (when you just got sent to the wrong school), you get your A** saved by your tank lover, and then you get shipped off to war, die, and you hear about how all the tanks are living their lives happily, you also may or may not get your hand blown off by a gernade. What... the actual..... [u]F***[/u] [/spoiler]

[spoiler] Now I'd beat up on this alot harder if it wasnt for the fact the humor of this game amused me so well, and the fact all the tanks seem decently well fleshed out, they're not bad as characters, they follow common tropes too. However, I feel with more work they could be so much better. Like this game could legit be an awesome dating sim/VN. The hate doesnt come from salt, its the fact that there could have been so much more to the endings. At first I though I got a neutral ending. I mean you basically 1 night stand a tank you tried to romance and everything that you did, all the touching moments before hand, essentially mean nothing.... like literally nothing, it is the most unsatisfying ending to exist in the face of VN's and [u]PLAYED SAKURAS ANGELS FOR CHRIST SAKE[/u] so all in all, if DEVGRU-P added multiple endings for the tanks or if that was just the bad ending or a neutral ending thats fine. If you're gonna give us Tankfus (waifu + tank) then at least let us live happily with our metal doom machines in the shape of anime school girls! I mean common! I get this game is supposed to be humorus but thats just lazy writing! [/spoiler]

Ending rant over. Onto the final bit of this:

[h1]Pro & Cons[/h1]

[i]More "+"s or "-"s indicate the impact they have on a scale of 1 to 3: 1 = Important, 2 = Very Important, 3 = Detrimentally Important[/i]

[u]Pros:[/u]
+++Actually alot of fun to play tbh
+++Devs have said they're planning to continue working on this game and add content via Non paid DLC, which opens alot of possibilities!
++Great Humor, especially for tank fans
++Some legit moments where if you know old slang and the sort you will go speechless at "did she REALLY just say that?"
++Solid characters, nothing amazing but theres potential
++Devs are working on an H-Patch for those who want it (You guys rock)
+Has that little quirk to it that not many games typically do

[u]Cons:[/u]
---[b]HORRIBLE LACK OF ENDINGS AND SATISFACTION IN SAID ENDINGS[/b]
--Game feels a tad closer to a Beta almost ready for release than a full game in a variety of areas
-Not Particularly worth 10 dollars due to the above
-Art could use a bit of improvement
-Sound track budget seems to be Free.99, Kevin's music is nice, but some basic "feel good" music made by someone in FL could have given this more personality....
-The game DOES NOT play nice with the Steam UI at all, cant open the interface and any requests to watch the game will get permanently stuck in the bottom right corner.
-Seems to lack a fullscreen option (falls in line with the "Unfinished feeling" of this game combined with the above)
-This game gets a bit buggy at times, at one point a bunch of text just raced by and i missed about 30 dialouge boxes for no clear reason which stopped when I clicked again.
-Only 5 save slots :/
-Your friends will probably never look at you the same again.


[h1]Conclusion:[/h1]

This game has ALOT of potential to be a great game, but right now, its a good game. And good games arent really worth a 10 dollar price tag especially when you get hit with the endings. This game is best around the 5 dollar range, and even then a full 10 bucks isnt wasted if you play through the lines and get your dose of tank humor out of it. However, if you wanted to see yourself marry a tank [spoiler]In the games current state, that aint gonna happen, wait till they add endings that support that or someone gets around to modding that in.[/spoiler] The game is really solid despite all the cons listed above and I dont regret my purchase, especially since there is promise of content patches up coming, so anyone who has this game better support the devs so we can get some more tanks, tank humor, a Maus, and better endings.

Feels: 7/10 - Had its moments, especially with the Tiger I
Gameplay: 9/10 - Seemed pretty fluid and not too clunky to get into certain plot arcs
Characters: 7/10 - Pretty solid, could be better with future updates on personality
Art: 6/10 - Good, not appauling, Could be improved over time
Music: 5/10 - Its ok 
Ending(s): 0/10 - *Repeated Facedesking* If they just added happy endings...

Total: 6.3/10, Good, but could be better. Still Reccomend however, I enjoyed it, but it needs work. If they make it better, ill edit my Review. (also add the Maus! My beloved wiafu!)

28914520.review: The endings are the same, regardless as to whatever you do. Regardless, it's still very funny if you are a history nerd, or a tank nerd. Lots of tankery-based innuendos and situational history jokes. A few puns and lots of moments where it breaks from the stereotypes of the genre of "visual novel" as it's really more of a parody of the genre than a serous game. It still stands well alone though, and is kind of fun. "Skip" skips everything including unseen text  and doesn't stop when you get to new stuff. Not playable in fullscreen. The main menu has a feature where you can turn the menu theme from floweredy and cutesy to mighty U.S.S.R. via a button down in the bottom left. 28616847.review:
In this game, you play as Erwin Lommer, a recent American recruit attending a prestigious military academy in the Akihabara district of Tokyo, Japan. When he shows up for his first day of "Tank School" he is surprised to learn that the students themselves are literal tanks who just-so happen to look exactly like Japanese schoolgirls (it makes about as much sense in context). Now Erwin must navigate the life of a Japanese high schooler all while being confused at his circumstances, but maybe he can also find love at this unusual school.

If you are reading this review, you are probably already aware of the fact that this is a parody game. Specifically, it is a parody of Japanese-style visual novels/dating simulators. Like in a visual novel, you make choices along the course of the story that dictates the player-character's relationship with the various characters in the game.

Being a parody, the main attraction here is the writing and humor. In this case, the humor is excellent. I found myself cracking up all the time playing this. The game itself contains parodies of the visual novel genre and anime in general. Many of the characters in the game are parodies of the usual anime clichés such as the yandere, the tsundere, the otaku, and so on. Not only that, but the military theme of the game contains many references to the tanks and events of World War II, giving the game even more of a variety of jokes. In addition, the Gunnery Sergeant Heartmann character was a hilarious parody of the similarly named character from the 1987 film [i]Full Metal Jacket[/i]. The game never stops being aware of just how stupid and silly the entire concept is and, as such, never stops being funny right up until the end.

The other aspects of the game necessarily take a back seat to the humor, but it mostly works well. The sprites were well-drawn and distinctive. I also thought the music used was pretty good.

However, my only real criticism of this would be the interface. There is an option to skip text, but no separate option to skip only text that has already been read. Plus, the skipping does not include scene transitions which means a longer wait to get where I want to go. This was frustrating when I was trying to see all of the game's content. There is also no option to go back to previous text in case I missed a line. Plus, there was only five save slots which does not seem enough when trying to explore all of the game's routes.

I am not sure if this game is worth the full $9.99 asking price, but I was able to buy it on sale 50% off and I think I got my money's worth. If you are looking for some great laughs in a rather unconventional parody, look no further than this.

[b]Update:[/b] Okay, right up until the ending, I was all for this game. The writers grasp on comedy, or what constitutes a good ending are non-existent. I mean, the game was certainly non-sensical to start with, but the ending comes so far out of left field… ugh. Recommendation changed.

[b]Big note for new players:[/b] Make sure you do not pay attention to the names on the steam cards until you are further into the game though, as I had several character types spoiled for me by the steam trading card, Character Name - the Architype (Yandere, Tsundere, etc)

On a technical side, there are several issues that make the game feel incomplete. The music (what there is) does not loop, so if you are like me and have a child or something distracting you, you can come back and be rewarded with text with no sounds what so ever until the next scene loads. This could be something to do with the engine used (it's definitely not Ren'py, which is weird these days), as the developer has mentioned on a few posts in the tech support forum that it is limited. Which brings me to the second issue… no full screen mode. In fact, no scaling at all.

The other nitpick is the end of line cursor, which is a little bouncing bob thing… makes it look like there are extra quotation marks in the lines that should not be there, but that might just be a very weird, very specific thing that bugs me because my professional editor whacks my knuckles with a cane if I have extra punctuation in my own work.

Certainly hope that the developer has moved to something a little better supported, like Ren'py, or even Unity if they are really keen… but

[h1]Даже не знаю можно ли рекомендовать эту визуалку.  [/h1]
Но нужно начать по порядку.
Что в игре хорошо:
+ Юмор. Крайне специфичная вещь полная культурных [strike]стереотипов[/strike] отсылок в стиле "Польша не может в космос" и историческо\технических. В основном конечно ко 2 мировой и крайним событиям.  Правда в нагрузку к ним выступают ЧЗН моменты.
+ Персонажи. Хорошо проработанные [strike]клише[/strike] характеры позволяют выбрать наиболее интересную вам героиню(машину?).
Нейтрально можно выделить:
[list]
    [*]Реиграбельность. Пройти все руты можно решить, но никаких кардинальных решений которые полностью меняют ощущения от игры тут не ждите. Некоторые фразы даже поленились поменять у героинь или просто добавили "CYKA BLYAD". Крайне оригинально. Хлопаю стоя.
[/list]
Ну а теперь минусы:
- Сюжет. Он как бы есть, но его и нет так же как и персонажи [strike]клиширован[/strike] не столь оригинален и притягателен.
- Концовка. Да это отдельный пункт потому что её как бы нет. Просто считайте что игра заканчивается ибо то что есть в игре это не концовка, а просто отсутствие нормального варианта окончить историю.
-Задники. Ну это замыленные снимки и всё с ними.
[b] А что в итоге?[/b]
Её было приятно проходить первый раз. C самого начале мне очень понравились[i] тематические шутки[/i]. Хоть сюжет и был клеширован до невозможности, проходить было интересно. 
Но! Концовка портит всё впечетление. Только ты полностью втянулся в игру и ждешь что же будет дальше... Как вдруг игра тебя бьёт по лицу как внезапный crossline Эмброуза и всё. Спасибо что поиграли увидимся ещё. 

Лично мне игра понравилась, но крайне коротка и шутки крайне специфичны (Хотя если вы читаете отзыв на симулятор свиданий с танко девушками то вы должны быть готовы к этому).
И да если тебя интересуют цифры то 
[h1]6\10(дополнительный бал только за наличие потрясающего тигра 1.) [/h1]
You are welcome.

This game is absolutely hilarious and the WWII/Cold War humor is a unique thing.  Which brings me to this next point.

I've noticed that some people find the game offensive because of the above mentioned humor.  You are of course entitled to your opinion but I would like to say that not only has it been two generations since the WWII, not only do many soldiers make light of their own history and actions, but that frankly, humor is a good start to heal any lingering wound

The humor doesn't even touch upon the wars themselves.  There is reference to a war with the "Plane Girls" but the rest of the humor is completely harmless.  This game is as harmless as a Richard Pryer show.  Sure it might be controversial to some but in the end its just humor.

So if you like laughing, know your history and Tanks and like those Tanks to be Moe, then give this a shot.  You won't be disappointed.  If you need further incentive, you can watch TSF's Yes Yes Love Adventure Go!  playthrough where they make a single run through the game.  At the least those guys will make you laugh if you find the game's humor not to your tastes.

24731181.review:
I do want to recommend this game.  Well, this story.  There's no actual game here.  The choices are largely irrelevant and have no impact on the actual outcome other than who shows up where - and even then, only sometimes.  Some of the humor is pretty good, and the characters are likable enough for what is effectively a harem anime.

But this game just feels a bit lazy overall.  It has a strange theme that makes people curious, screenshots of a few of the jokes, it's enough to make some people (myself included) decide to buy it - on sale - and see what it's really like.  And it delivers, to a degree.  There are some references to the actual tanks the girls are named after.  Some of their personality traits can be assigned due to their country of origin.  But the personalities have about as much depth as a saucer of milk.  And the writing, unfortunately, contains several plot points that get immediately dropped that COULD have actually gone somewhere.  That and some things in the game really should be explained.

It's short, it's sloppy, it goes nowhere, and it ends rather abruptly.  And, while it contains a "skip" feature, using it will likely crash the game as it can try to forward faster than the engine can actually handle.

Also, the jokes in the screen shots?  Not actually in the game.  There are similar jokes told by other characters, but never the ones you see like that.  The world doesn't make sense - which at least your invisible protagonist self points out a few times - and the characters largely don't behave in any reasonable way.  Which is a shame, because you see hints of a good idea here and there, something that COULD be explored in depth.  Instead, they just hope you know about Kancolle and think this is similar enough to pay for.  It's not.  Sorry.  Put some more time in the writing, make decisions MATTER, give some logic and actually follow up on the plot threads you keep leaving around and there could be something unique and special here.  As it stands, this is the "visual novel" equivalent of Buzzfeed clickbait.  "Top 15 tanks turned into high-school girls, you won't believe number 7!"

Edit: It occurs to me that there IS another game out there, with an equally silly theme, that shows that good writing is still possible.  Hyperdimension Neptunia Re;birth 1.  Don't let a silly theme make you shy away from telling a good story.

24158870.review:
[b] Target Audience: [/b] [I] Those looking for sexual tank jokes.....on sale.. [/i]

[b] Summary: [/b] 
Panzermadels tries to follow in the steps of Hatoful Boyfriend, but fails in the charm and substance portion of the dating simulator genre. While the game does a great job of using sexual innuendo regarding tank warfare, it fails to create characters that are truly interesting, and makes you want to woo them. The personal connection isn't there, as inconsistencies within the characters personalities can make for an uneven experience. In addition, things are too off the wall at times, making you truly wonder exactly what the reasoning was for adding satanic rituals into a characters backstory. And when different characters you are wooing end up feeling the same due to a lack of variation in the plot, you feel like you're just playing the same story that you've played before. Sadly, Panzermadels only reinforces how well Hatoful Boyfriend was put totgether, and just doesn't do the job in keeping me interested in the characters or the plot that was unfolding. For me, it's a pass. 

[b]Video Review: [/b] https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WCXlGFG6GzQ

[u] Lists: [/u]
[b]Positives:[/b]
[list]
[*] The innuendo using tank and warfare terms is on point. Ammo ranks and Armor penetration. Well done. 
[*] The use of tropes makes it feel familiar for those who played the genre, while still putting a tiny spin on it with the tank girl elements of it.
[*] The T34 storyline did tie in the Russian/communism element rather well. 
[*] The artwork is reasonable. Nothing too out there, it feels like a typical dating sim. 
[*] There are some touching moments within the story, and it's what I wanted to see more of in the end. It can tug on heartstrings a bit. 
[/list]

[b]Negatives:[/b]
[list]
[*] The lack of variation between the storylines of the different girls is disappointing. While you want an overarching storyline, you want some uniqueness for each of the arcs. 
[*] The heritage angles don't work very well at times. The german tank for example, it's a Japanese Otaku in disguse. And while that's not a problem in itself, it's the problem of going back and forth between the German and Japanese angles. 
[*] The ending feels like the developers ran out of money, and just threw something together. It doesn't work, as it feels like you just spent the last hour and a half doing nothing to affect your own fate.
[*] The characters just don't have the spark behind them to really get me interested. They all don't really stand out, they feel too relaxed in the overall picture. 
[*] Look, I like off the wall shenanigans at times, but even here things really felt like a stretch. The satanic ritual portion just whiffs at being used effectively. 
[*] Sound is lacking. The overuse of the AOL instant messenger exiting sound not only got annoying, it was distracting. And with no audio sliders, you can't adjust it compared to the music.
[*] Lack of resolution options, hell, no fullscreen option either.
[/list]

24089138.review:
[b]In short[/b]

Pros:
[list]
[*]Funny tank puns
[/list]

Cons:
[list]
[*]Terrible UI
[*]Complete lack of character writing
[*]No depth of gameplay
[*]No replay value
[/list]
	
[b]In detail[/b]

Panzermadels is a 'game' in the style of a dating sim, where you seduce a friendly WW2 tank. Think Hatoful Boyfriend, but with tanks. Though, as I'll explain, the comparison to Hatoful Boyfriend is completely unearned.

The game has some very good tank puns and some good humour. I really enjoyed the first play through I did for that reason. Things really don't hold up for a second play through, and here's why…
[olist]
[*]The scene-skipping mechanic is awful. In most VNs or dating sims you'll have some equivalent play/pause button in the screen borders. In this game you just have a menu button. If you want to start scene skipping, you have to go in through the menu both to activate and to deactivate skipping. However, this is very unresponsive, if you spot a scene you haven't already seen you generally can't slow the dialogue back down in time to read it.
[*]For a large number of scenes, the tank girls are completely interchangeable. In total, there are maybe only three places where you'll get a choice of scene, plus an extra place if you make some of the right dialogue options. It's disappointing. Certain tank girls also have much better and funnier unique scenes than others. Combined with the poor UI for scene skipping I find this frustrating.
[*]Most half decent dating sims / VNs will generally have hidden stats or consequences for certain options. I'm at my third play through, I've not noticed that any of the choices I've made differently have affected my ability to choose particular tanks at the end. So long as you interact with someone enough that makes them an option. 
[*]There are also plenty of 'choices' that do precisely nothing to the outcome. There are also places that jarred for me with the storytelling - one tank girl had complete amnesia about a conversation we'd had only days ago.
[*]Because of the above combined, there's really not any replay value. Unless you're stubborn, like I am. I'm now mostly playing it on skip in the background while I do other things so that I can collect the endings. A play through in skip mode probably takes 20 minutes, a full play through is probably 40 minutes.
[/olist]

Would I recommend this game? Not really.
If you want cute schoolgirls combined exquisitely with tank jokes and other tank stuff, I heartily recommend you go and watch Girls Und Panzer. It's an amazing show. 
If you want a funny or surreal VN/dating sim, I heartily recommend you give Hatoful Boyfriend a try.  It's got a good range of characters, choices that matter, and an interesting story line that takes place over a full year (rather than the best part of a week).
If you're after smut, well… there are probably better things, to be honest.

24060778.review:
So the thing that first drew me to this game was the sheer hilarity of the concept.  I mean, you're going to school with WW2 tanks, and going on dates with them?  It's brilliantly hilarious!

Sadly, though, that's about all the game really had going for it.  The game hints at a larger world, with other "tanks" that you can chat/flirt with that don't affect the main story, which is always cool to see, but it doesn't lend anything to the game itself.  Out of the 8-9 tank ladies that the game shows off, only 5 are dateable, and the only reward is a pretty picture to add to your gallery.
Speaking of the story, the game's plot kinda has some hit-and-miss moments.  I mean, there's plenty of funny spots (My personal favorite is when you go to the convenience store and ask the shopkeep for headlight fluid.), but the story doesn't really feel rewarding.  Heck, even with the yandere character they have, they never take the opportunity to have your character kidnapped or anything.  She's just a creepy stalker.  None of the plotlines available have any real depth, and the moments that do have depth never lead to anything relevant, or are completely disconnected from the main story.

Oh, and as for the ending, there's two.  One is you go into active service and die in battle, and the other is death by firing squad.  I'll let you do the math fom there.

All in all, I really WANTED this VN to be fun.  It's got a fun idea, fun characters, and some witty dialogue.  But it never does anything with the interesting idea, the fun characters never really get developed (i mean story development, not character profiling), and the dialogue is only really funny the first time you read it.   It's good for a one-time playthrough, but nothing more than that.
Hopefully, they'll make a sequel to this game that does better.

23930669.review:
Panzermadels ist eins von [i]diesen[/i] Spielen. Die man nicht kauft, weil man denkt, das sie gut sind, sondern weil man wissen will wie schlecht sie sind. Zu denen man eine pseudolustige "I swear it was a gift xddddd"-Review schreibt, von der jeder weiß, dass sie gelogen ist. Und bei denen man mit jeder weiteren Ingame-Minute spürt, wie man mehr und mehr zum Bodensatz der Gesellschaft degeneriert.

Das Spiel an sich hat nicht viel zu bieten: Die Charakter sind so flach und klischeehaft wie nur irgend möglich, die Story ist praktisch inexistent (das Ende ist dermaßen abgehackt, als wäre den Machern mitten in der Produktion von einem Tag auf den anderen das Geld ausgegangen), Musik ist nur sporadisch vorhanden und die Grafik ist allenfalls zweckdienlich. Und wer auf heiße Nacktbilder der Schulmädchenpanzer gehofft hat wird auch enttäuscht. Was hat Panzermadels also zu bieten?

Geschichtsreferenzen, Panzerwortspiele, eindeutig zweideutige Witze. Eine kleine Auswahl von dem, was einen im Spiel erwartet:
- Sovjets leiten die Schülerzeitung, die sie mit erfundenen Geschichten und anderer Propaganda füllen (u.a. Putinwitze)
- Der Okkultisten-Club der Schule wird von Deutschen geleitet
- Der Lehrer ist ein amerikanischer Drill Sergeant, der auf Schulmädchen mit großen Ammoracks steht
- Judenwitze (Concentrated Orange Juice, usw...)
- Deutsche spielen ständig auf den Polenfeldzug an
- Der einzige polnische Panzer hat zwei Auftritte im Spiel, bei beiden wird sie fertig gemacht
- "She squeezes your hand with the force of a medium tank"
- Strandurlaub
- Panzer IV ist besessen von Japan unf schafft es kaum, zwei Sätze ohne SUGOIIIIII und kawaii~ zu bilden...desu
- Menschen, die sich Anwinkeln sollen, um Geschossen abprallen zu lassen
- Diskussionen über Rohrgrößen und ob bei Penetration eher das Kaliber oder die Zielfähigkeit entscheidend ist

Dabei schwankt das Spiel immer wieder zwischen beiläufigen Einwürfen, die einen zum Schmunzeln bringen, und miserablem In-Your-Face-Humor, bei dem man sich irgendwann fragt, wie man etwas derartiges schreiben kann, ohne sich gleichzeitig vor Selbsthass erschießen zu wollen. Man kann davon ausgehen, das System dahintersteckt, aber auch wenn man etwas mit Absicht schlecht macht wird es dadurch nicht unbedingt besser. Wenn man die Witze versteht und sich nicht zu schade ist, auch mal über Flachwitze zu lachen, kann das durchaus unterhaltsam sein, ansonsten ist es der pure Cringe Marathon.

Fazit: Ich hatte meinen Spaß mit dem Spiel, obwohl ich mir dabei vorkam wie der Abfall der Menschheit.

I bought Panzermadels because it looked weird and interesting and was on sale, and it delivered. It was both weird and interesting in a very fun way.

The characters follow some common tropes (ex: tsundere) in anime, VN, and manga. However, the way these tropes were tied into the tank framework was very interesting and made the game light hearted, and very enjoyable. The game contained numerous references to variety of subject matter, but mostly to WW2 and tanks in general. Many of these references were quite funny. 

Overall, Panzermadels was a blast to go through the first time and contained a lot of choices which made it feel engaging. Subsequent readings definitely feel lacking as the game doesn't change very much depending on your choices, and some choices appear to have no impact at all and were used to create an amusing moment. The characters were well written and it made me want to see more of some of the secondary characters to see how they would turn out. The biggest downside to this game is that the ending is quite bizarre and I felt didn't live up to the rest of the game. At the end, I was definitely a bit dissatisfied. I'm not sure if I'll go back for further read throughs yet as my first two were extremely similar, even though on my second time through I chose a character I ignored on the first. However, in a couple months I think the story will be far enough out of my mind that reading it again will be worth the jokes and references a different character will make.

23771910.review:
Gosh, where to start with Panzermadels? I guess it's always nice to start with all the lovely things you can say first, and then move on to the problems.

First and foremost, I do really do love this game's idea. It's cute, and silly, and very interesting. The idea that there's a school in Akihabara filled with girls who are also famous tanks throughout time? It's definitely odd, but it quickly becomes endearing. And the backgrounds of all the different tankgirls, and the things they talk about are great sources for tangential learning. I did quite a bit of wiki spelunking on this one. Before this game, I did not know New Zealand's first homegrown 'tank' design, or what 'tovarich' means. Those are just small examples.

The art, and most of the writing, are cute and snappy, helping to immerse you in a very weird world, but also in making it feel (somehow) quite real.  It does not quite manage this quite as well as NekoPara, or Highschool Romance, but considering the massive amount of suspension of disbelief required, it's still quite amazing how well they make you believe. Some of the human characters do more to derail this universe than the tankgirls do...

Unfortunately, the game is plagued by a few issues. Two of them objective, and one of them very subjective. Objectively, the game has several bad grammar - or pheraps, writing - errors that can impede understanding. A few times I thought I'd missed a line in a conversation. This came up more often near the end. Second, the game is apparently not bug free. During one of my playthroughs, I lavished all my attention on the IS-2, and somehow, the end of the game had me with the T-34. While semi amusing, I can't figure out exactly what went wrong there. (A lack of guides or information for this game doesn't help in that regard. Maybe it IS functioning as intended, but I have no way to verify that.)

Finally, the ending of the game. Ending, singular. Which tankgirl you decide to date has no apparent bearing on said ending; which may have been meant to be darkly comic, but instead, falls completely flat. Instead, it seems to take a cute, silly game, and move things into way too serious and depressing a direction. It was quite a shocking 180 for the game, and I played several times just to be sure this unfortunate ending was there every time.

In summation, I'm not sorry I spent the money on it, as I do love the premise. Rather, I feel the game needs more polish, and a much better ending. If you're a hardcore fan of wacky games, or dating sims, Panzermadels is worth a look, particularly on sale. But for the vast majority of STEAM users, this game is best passed up for better visual novels.

Do you like anime? Do you like visual novels? Do you like World War 2 trivia? Do you want to bang a tank? 

If you answered yes to all of these questions then Panzermadels: Tank Dating Simulator is the game for you. 

I got this game after watching it be played by a few YouTubers and since then I haven’t looked back. The idea of this game is fun, the characters are fun (yet oddly attractive), the story is fun and in my opinion the ending really suits the style of the game.

This is not a powerful and gritty visual novel, this isn’t a branching story with multiple endings and it most certainly isn’t a game that you want to tell your friends you bought. It is what it is, a tank dating simulator.

Pros
-	Lots of interesting characters
-	Lots of funny tank related puns
-	All of the usual troupes that you would expect to find in a generic anime or manga
-	Really rewarding dialog

Cons
-	Story can really only be played through 5 times before it gets repetitive
-	Some of the final scenes feel quite rushed
-	The ending of the game doesn’t change depending on the tank chosen
-	Can’t bang Bob Semple 

Overall I’d give this a solid 9/10 with higher marks available when the StuG DLC is added or you can bang Bob Semple.

I'm often very tame when it comes to visual novels. There are thousands of good visual novels out there, many in which, have very good content.... However.... Panzermadels does and doesn't have that and can be completed within an hour or 30 minutes depending on your reading pace.

Pros:
Good story.
Lots of Likable characters.
Lots of puns and a good laugh.
Tanks, lots of tanks.

Cons:
The game barely has any BGM, if not none at all.
The backdrops weren't that impressive.
Lacks any amount of CG besides one for each route.
Some scenarios will give information and then completely forget it was told in later scenarios.
Lacks any form of actual character endings.
Forced ending that was pretty bad.

Neutral:
I would include no voice acting but I've seen cases where this works and doesn't work.

Overall, I think it's a good game but lacks any form of appeal in it's design besides it's characters. If you want to play a game with a decent story to have a good laugh, this is the game for you. Otherwise if anything from the cons turns you away I wouldn't recommend purchasing this at full price. Otherwise the artwork was pretty good for what it offered and was a fun experiance.

7/10 - Too little CG
Though Steam doesn't allow for a neutral standpoint, I have to down thumbs this.

tl;dr
Would I suggest the game? Yes. Very much yes. Penetrate some armor and enjoy a very 'internet'-style humor. If you aren't a tank buff, you might learn a thing or two. Just don't expect a very fufilling (or good) ending.

Spoiler-free review
So, bought this game after eyeing it for its absurdity and strange nature. Came into a bit of expendable money, so I grabbed it. I laughed the whole way through and enjoyed it more than I thought I would, lost track of time and had a great time with all the humor, which can be very dark at times (I will describe one of the times that sprung to mind in the spoilerific review below). I was taken by the charm it had, even if it wasn't perfect in execution which I was willing to overlook when they came up. The problem I had was the same as many of the other reviews; the ending. It took me out of the experience and just killed the steam I had, at least at the time of writing this... I may likely pick it back up to see what other options it has to offer.

This part of the review will involve the spoilers. Proceed at your own risk.
When I started the game, I had never played a dating sim because they never really interested me, but as anyone that looks at my library will see, I love the little oddballs when I can find or get them. The first half hour, I was mostly trying to figure out the details of what everything was about. The rest of the time, I was rather pleased to fall into the jokes and the charm I spoke of earlier - You're sent to check on the German tanks by the VP to make sure they're not summoning the elder gods again. Which is precicely what they were up to, and the entire scene made me grin like an idiot. You suggest they take up a bake sale, which you regret near instantly.. WW2 era tanks and ovens apparently don't mix well. That entire scene was one of my favorite of all the humor because of how it unfolded; they needed money for a class trip and their first thought was to dive head first into the occult, summon the elder gods for money or weapons which led into holocaust jokes. A bit of the charm I spoke of earlier that just endeared itself to me. All is great even after the hot springs (Where I somehow ended up spending the night with a super tank).

Now, again, I loved the gameplay and was able to forgive the oversights for what the game was. As I've said before, the end completely took the steam out of my sails with the abrupt and honestly... Compeltely lazy way it was handled. I get that it's supposed to lampoon the dating genre and maybe I'm missing some vital element here since i've never played any other dating sim but... What the hell happened? All of the charm, all of the humor... All of it was tossed in the trash bin the moment you get your tank girl. Suddenly, you're drug to a kangaroo court where, for some reason Heartmann is your lawyer and its his first case. The judge decides you're guilty from the moment you step into the room, but the girl you romanced comes to your defense (Or not at all, in IS-2's case). The whole thing of going AWOL is... Slightly hinted at in the very beginning but it's dropped when Heartmann cuts you off from talking to the school's admin. Even if you manage to beat the AWOL charges, you still get slammed with fornicating with a military vehicle which Heartmann publicly denounces and pretty much signs your guilty verdict there. The entire game, he's been the biggest pervert regarding the tanks and he was the butt of many a joke regarding this, even giving you tank porn at one point (Showing it's sold, publically... Wouldn't it be punishable to even own these things if it was something you can get court marshalled over...?)

I mean I'm probably overthinking a game like this, but again, I really enjoyed the humor and charm it supplied til the sudden end... And it disappointed hard there. I mean if it built up to it, had some more flavor than "Oh shit, we need to end this game somehow...", I would be much happier about it. Again, I'm probably missing some vital part of this puzzle here in the parody of the dating sim type game, but I don't even care if it was a happy ending. You spend the entirety of the game laughing and getting to like these characters to have it all... Dustbinned to end the game in an almost copy-and-paste ending where all you have done amounts to virtually nothing.


?/10 Would likely lay a tank to waste in bed again and stop Panzer from summoning Cthulu again.

22333093.review:
Well, this VN has been on my list since the day I saw it announced. I've recently been getting very into visual novels, mostly Japanese localizations, but I'll play any kind.

This one definitely failed to impress.

Lack of music or sound in 90% of the game
CG artwork being in a completely different art style
Lack of options of basically any kind
No full screen
And to top it all off, it reads like a 12-year-old's fanfiction in many places

There are positives to the game; lots of tank and war jokes that will make you chuckle no matter how much you dislike the game, a pretty good variety of choices and a very interesting concept to say the least.
But, I think the main issue with the game was just the lack of direction. It's more focused on memes and corny jokes than it is any kind of story or character development. It felt very jumbled up and hastily put together. I suppose it really didn't need to be well put together seeing how this game is immensly popular with the "LOL SO LMFAO" crowd.

If you make YouTube videos, buy this game and play it in full, you'll get a billion views and a couple huge checks.
If you're like me and like quality VNs, save yourself the $10 and pick up School Days or If My Heart Had Wings, they'll give you much more bang for your buck.

A few critical notes---- for ten bux, its entirely wayyyy too short. This should cost half that. Even though i enjoyed it and am very happy it even exists i feel like i got ripped off a bit. $5 for this would have been right on point. Nextly, if you don't know alot about wwii/ the cold war, you are going to miss out on a HUGE amount of humor in this game. for sure the strongest aspect of this game are the technical references and historical references, which are true and factual, woven into a reality they were never meant to be in...that IS the prevailing joke...so if you don't know, for example, that certain german tanks had transmission issues, you are missing out on a joke....and there are hundreds of these style jokes in here. Lastly, the trbunal ending thing was a cheap way out to a very abrupt and unresolved ending. TERRIBLE ending. So the main portion of the game was really fun/funny and well researched, game is too short for $10, and the end was  abrupt and terrible. alright, realtalk, realtalk:
this game is pretty glorious.  the characters are anime archetypes, yes, but that's part of the joke. note that this review will contain spoilers, and i've only played....panzer, tiger, and 20's routes, so take that as you will. anywho....

[h1]girls included:[/h1]

panzer iv: basically /pol/'s dream girl. her hobbies include blood rituals, japanese fangirling, and being a nazi. i kinda wish i was kidding on that, but no, that's actually what she's into.  i dig it. 

tiger i: panzer's hot and clumsy cousin. she's got big racks of ammo, and she enjoys fashion. she's probably also involved with blood rituals and being a nazi to some degree. 

i-20: your stalker. glorious mother russia's pride and joy, don't  keep her stalin for too long. ha. ha. ha. she's also able to drink you under the table and she's always watching. always.

t-34: tsundere. also russian. didn't really interest me, but she's probably the girl out there for some russian tsundere lover.

m4 sherman: basically tomo from azumanga daioh, but a tank. she's the typical high energy american girl who has nothing to lose. she's also kinda dumb as bricks.

those are the main girls. there's also a hot british tank who goes to another school (you can xxx her. i wish i could choose her as official girl, but alas, no such luck.), a few other various tanks, and also the drill sgt from full metal jacket is there (why no route for gunney i wanna date gunney). 

[h1]overview:[/h1]

basically, you're at a normal all-girl high school except all the girls are tanks and you're taught how to not be a maggot by the best sensei ever.  the routes all seem to progress the same way, so i kinda got bored after doing 3 of them. there are a few dialogue differences and of course they depend on the girl you picked, but overall it still progresses the same way.

[h1]here's the spoiler section[/h1]

the ending is exactly the same no matter what you do. you're sent to court for going awol, gunney tries to defend you, that fails, if you're lucky a girl rushes in to defend you, and then they realized you xxxed a tank and you're sentenced to some other punishment for xxxing a tank. (or you're just shot if no girl comes to help you.) the fact that there's almost no difference with any of the endings is what really upset me and got me to stop playing the game, otherwise, if there were unique endings, i gladly would've played it again for any of the girls.

[h1]recommendations to the devs:[/h1]

- change the ending. the ending sucks. i'm sentenced to death for making sweet glorious love to that steely posterior, and i don't get to live the rest of my life with my tankwife? not a good ending. give the girls separate endings along with cgs at the end, and i'll replay it for every single character released.  (or at least have yandere tank come in and defend me instead of abandoning my ass last minute)
- make a cg gallery option, so i can go back and view glorious tank ass again without replaying the route entirely and so i can remember which routes i played and which i haven't.
- options menu where i can control text speed, music on/off, skip previously viewed text, etc, etc. there are some awkward moments  where there's no music whatsoever and i feel like playing my own music, but then it suddenly cuts back in. 
- (optional) trading cards and wallpaper for our steam profile to display waifus. emoticons are nice too. who knows when i need to express my emotions through a picture of i-20?

[h1]finale:[/h1]

do i recommend the game? hell yeah i do. ride that glorious tank ass to destiny, my friends. but there's still room for improvement and i think it could be upped with patches, definitely. the game's not for everyone and you have to have a thick skin to laugh at some of the jokes based on war tragedy but it's about as bad as, say, a female-based version of hetalia, so, y'know. if you're okay with it with hot guys, hot girls isn't much different.

I have to preface this review by saying, this the the first "visual novel" game I've ever played.

I've never really been a fan of Japanese style games but after seeing some Youtube footage, I decided to purchase it.  Firstly, this game definitely seems more of a parody of the genre than a serious visual novel. That said, it is brillant! Each "Girl" actually characterizes each Tank pretty well, and I learned a bit of history too! Panzermadels: Tank Dating Simulator :

Summary:

Erwin Lemmor just got transferred to a prestigious military academy to study Armored Warfare. But when he arrives, Erwin realizes it's not Tank School, but "Tank School" for World War II Tanks. Who happen to look just like Japanese School Girls...! 
Instead of studying military history and doctrine, he's in "Basic Artillery Computations for Fire Support 101", and "Radio Operations 214". Will he win the heart of the tank-girls, or end up as cannon fodder? Only you can decide in, "Panzermadels: Tank Dating Simulator".
Panzermadels is made by 'DEVGRU-P' a small team of American developers in the style of a traditional Japanese Visual Novel. Unabashedly goofy, the game takes every trope you know from visual novels, and puts a distinctly Tank-Related twist on them! With six different romance plot-lines and a multiple of endings based on your choices, Panzermadels will keep you entertained for a number of playthroughs!

When she isn't in class, she likes shopping for new armored skirts, and other accessories. She loves her younger cousin, Panzer IV with all her heart!

21823342.review:
I heard about this game on the podqisition podcast thanks to the lovely Laura K.  I must say that I do enjoy the overall theme of the game and the tank innuendo is a nice touch.  The only real issues I have with the game are all in the user interface.

Pros: 
-nice humor
-tanks all have flaws based on the tank models they were designed after
-reasonably priced for the content you get

cons:
-to scroll through the text you need to click the mouse button.  To the best of my knowledge this cant be rebound.  My personal preferance is to either use the mouse wheel or the down button and the constant need to click is annoying to me (though I know that is just personal taste)

-I haven't found a way to go back in a conversation.  In most games like this you can press either the up button or spin the mouse wheel up to read past parts of a conversation.  I personally like this feature encase i missed part of a joke.

-As far as I can tell there is no full screen mode.  (again personal preference)

_lastly there is no option to change text speed.  The current speed is ok but I find that I tend to read faster than the scrolling allows.  This can be remedied with a double click of the mouse but it simply feels like an extra step.

All in all it is a nice game that I feel just needs so minor tweaks that can be remedied with a better options screen.  This is a purchase that was worth my money and will be looking for future games from DEVGRU-P

21761541.review:
Final Verdict:

It doesn't make a  whole lot of sense.

But it's just so hilarious that that doesn't matter.

Detailed Review:

In this VN, you play as a guy dating iconic WWII tanks personified as Japanese schoolgirl. It doesn't get much weirder than that. And this weirdness is the game's selling pont, as well as its biggest strength. And the game delivered this strength very very well and in the most memorable way possible.

The game is not without its flaw, however. The main premise doesn't make a whole lot of sense and would probably irritate serious readers (that somehow pick up a story about dating personified tanks and try to make some senses out of it). There are technical issues like s bug in a conversation. There are also no option for full screen (not a problem for me) or mute (which I find a little problematic, as I normally play VN with the sounds off) and there are only 5 save slots, which aren't nearly enough. And the ending is very abrupt and confusing and doesn't reflect enough the player's choice. The first time I reached it, I thought that I had hit some wrong conversation options somewhere and locked myself int a bad end. No, that's just the ending...

But still, despite all the flaws I have mentioned, the good far outshines the bad. The writing of this game is pure, comedic gold and the jokes are top notched, especially if you have some knowledge on WWII and history in general. The tank girls are adorable and manage to reflect the quirks of the tanks they represent very, very well (though I'm a little disappointed that they focus more on Tiger I's mechanical problems than legendary prowess, but, well, they aren't wrong). There are a lot of choices in the conversation which, why doesn't affect the story much, give the player the satisfying illusion of control, as well as open up to many different jokes and make the flow of conversations seem natural. It's one of the most bizarre and hilarious VNs I've ever read and I've a lot of fun with it. And since the devs are still working to fix bugs and add in stuffs, I'm sure it will only get better with time.

21757330.review:
This game gives you the choice of riding a variety of tanks. You have to choose your tank wisely, as each one has their strengths and weaknesses depending on the terrain and situation.
 
For example, the M4 is a very versatile medium tank with a 75mm gun, and although it's armour isn't particularly strong, a skilled commander can utilize it's sloped surfaces and rounded turret for maximum effect. Meanwhile, the T34 has great sloped armour and wide tracks for effective traverse in rough terrain, but lacks the more sophisticated equipment and reliability of the Pz.IV. Of course, choosing the legendary Tiger I might be tempting with it's great 88mm and thick front armour, but you have to be mindful of it's unreliable engine.

I have to admit though, that the selection of tanks could, and should have been greater. There are several other NPC tanks that you will meet through the game, like the Maus and the B1, but unfortunately you don't get to drive them. The areas in the game are also not as varied as they could have been, but includes a beach, a mountain and several urban areas.

However, despite it's shortcomings, this is a very charming tank simulator.

21751053.review:
In Panzermadels you play as a guy named Erwin, who is enlisted into tank school. You must search around trying to find the place, but when you do find the place things aren’t as you imagined. From there the game turns wild. The developer supplied a review copy for me.

I spent around 3 hours playing the game. There are 5 romance routes, but depending on your choice early then you may have an early ending. Each playthrough takes around 2 hours-2 hours 30 mins. I don't want to talk too deeply about the story but it's pretty wacky (in a bizarre sense) and there were always new surprises around each corner.


Positives

Choices – A lot of VN’s miss out on this part, they forget to let the reader have choices and gladly this game has an array of choices to choose from.
Music – The music is well chosen and goes well with the game.
Pretty creative and confusing – The game is highly creative, somehow associating vehicles with humans and managing to combine them. 
Funny and didnt stop suprising me – Right from the start the ‘wackiness’ of the game had me laughing, especially the crazy drill sergeant. The game didn’t stop surprising me and the scenarios I encountered kept me laughing for a while.
Art style is pretty good considering it's an indie game – Most indie VN’s I have played have had a more rougher art style but this game has pretty nice art and an abundance of backdrops keeping the game fresh.
“Ammo Racks, Armored Plating and Amphibious attachments” – The game is completely riddled with Innuendos and most of the times I could not help but facepalm and laugh at what I was reading. 

Negatives

Spelling errors – At the beginning there were a few spelling errors but nothing that major. 
Only 5 save slots – This limits you to how many saves you can have. This can be a minor for most who love to save often.
story crossing – This may be wrong but t34 give me number on hill then next day in class she had to give me her number again apparently and was reluctant about it.
Lack of audio options and customisation – There are no real settings in options like audio sliders or font text. 


Overall, I had a lot of fun with this game. Mostly due to the innuendos and randomness that the game is. It made me laugh quite often and I could easily recommend it to gamers who are looking for a game which is a bit more extraordinaire and bizarre. The price is a tad high but if you feel it’s not that much of a dent on your wallet then go for it. 

The only qualm I have with this game is that sometimes I felt like my choices were not really remembered at all. I did have a fun time though and again, this was a real funny game.
